downmarket.translation[0].definitions[0]: downmarket goods or services are cheap and not of very good quality
The company wanted to break away from its traditional, downmarket image.
downmarket.translation[2].definitions[0]: involving goods and services that are cheap and not very good quality compared to similar goods or services
The mail order business has never been able to break away from its traditional downmarket image.
downmarket.translation[3].definitions[0]: to start buying or selling cheaper goods or services
Mercedes will move further downmarket with the Smart car.
downmarket.translation[3].definitions[1]: to change a product or a service, or peopleâ€™s ideas about it, so that it is cheaper or seems cheaper and more popular
He was accused of taking BBC Radio 3 downmarket to compete with a new commercial station.
